intro: Voacanga schweinfurthii var. puberula, commonly known as the African locust bean tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by elongated, pod-like fruits containing seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
